DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the outcome of an event.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._A condition or event that is attributed to the adverse event and is the result or conclusion of the adverse event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unwanted effect caused by a drug or therapy.  Such effects can be drug related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another drug, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Change concept code to C41331 as C2861 is retired per EVS. dw

Property.preferredDefinition: A condition or event that is attributed to the adverse event and is the result or conclusion of the adverse event.

Concepts.definition: A condition or event that is attributed to the adverse event and is the result or conclusion of the adverse event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Adverse Event Outcome Terminology Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology associated with the adverse event outcome codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM)._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event is improving.

Concepts.definition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event is improving.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has not improved or recuperated.

Concepts.definition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has not improved or recuperated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome where the subject recuperated but retained pathological conditions resulting from the prior disease or injury.

Concepts.longName: Recovered from Adverse Event with Sequelae
Concepts.definition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome where the subject recuperated but retained pathological conditions resulting from the prior disease or injury.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has improved or recuperated.

Concepts.definition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has improved or recuperated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The termination of life associated with an adverse event.

Concepts.definition: The termination of life associated with an adverse event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: CDISC Controlled Terminology is used to indicate the outcome of the event as it relates to the subject's status. The Outcome controlled terminology includes ICH E2B values.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the appropriate outcome of the event in relation to the subject's status.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.
